wikipedia_page.main: Jeanette Anne Kessler (4 October 1908 – 18 March 1972) was a British alpine skier who competed in the 1936 Winter Olympics. In 1936 she finished eighth in the alpine skiing combined event. She married James Riddell in 1959.

link_mentions.page: Great Britain at the 1936 Winter Olympics

response: He married another former ski racer, Jeanette Kessler, in 1959, and their combined knowledge of the Alps resulted in a Penguin handbook, Ski Holidays In The Alps, a source book for many skiers and travel writers. In it, Riddell wrote: "You do it because, once you have tried it and taken to it, there isn't any other game to compare with it in the world."
